commands.title: Stencila: Run all nodes in document
Stencila: Run all executable code nodes in document
Stencila: Run all assistant nodes in document
Stencila: Run all nodes above the cursor
Stencila: Run all nodes below the cursor
Stencila: Cancel all running nodes in the document

walkthroughs.title: Writing with the `insert-paras` assistant
walkthroughs.description: The ``insert-paras`` specialized assistant uses context from your document to make generic AI more relevant and accurate.

steps.title: Getting started
steps.description:
• The ``insert-paras`` is one of Stencila's specialized AI assistants. It summarizes context from your document, including metadata and content, and passes it to generic LLMs.

• First, create a new Stencila Markdown [file](command:stencila.walkthrough-file-open?%22demo-insert-paras.smd%22)

• Then add some metadata to the document with [title and keywords](command:stencila.walkthrough-file-type?%5B%22demo-insert-paras.smd%22%2C%22---%5Cntitle%3A%20An%20analysis%20of%20impact%20of%20environmental%20variables%20on%20tree%20height%5Cnkeywords%3A%20%5B%5C%22tree%5C%22%2C%20%5C%22height%5C%22%2C%20%5C%22environmental%20variables%5C%22%5D%5Cn---%22%5D)

• Next, get started by [adding a heading and an instruction](command:stencila.walkthrough-file-type?%5B%22demo-insert-paras.smd%22%2C%22%5Cn%5Cn%23%20Introduction%5Cn%5Cn%3A%3A%3A%20do%20%40insert-paras%2040-60%20word%20introductory%20paragraph%5Cn%5Cn%22%5D), assigned to ``insert-paras``

• Run the instruction.

steps.title: Refining suggestions
steps.description:
• If you are happy with the suggestion from ``insert-paras``, you can accept it. This will stop the instruction from being executed again (unless you explicitly do so).

• If you are __not__ happy with the suggestion you can request a retry, modify the instruction, or edit the suggestion.

• You can click on the ```View`` button to inspect the instruction.

walkthroughs.title: Frictionless AI Integration
walkthroughs.description: Getting started with Stencila's AI Assistants

steps.title: Stencila uses Markdown
steps.description:
Let's create some basic markdown.

Starting with [a title](command:stencila.walkthrough-file-type?%5B%22walkthru-1.smd%22%2C%22%5Cn%23%20A%20simple%20document%5Cn%22%5D)

And then some [formatted text](command:stencila.walkthrough-file-type?%5B%22walkthru-1.smd%22%2C%22%5CnWe%20can%20write%20some%20text%20with%20__formatting__%20and%20%5Blinks%5D%28https%3A%2F%2Fstencila.com%29.%5Cn%22%5D)

Now we can [add some code](command:stencila.walkthrough-file-type?%5B%22walkthru-1.smd%22%2C%22%5Cn%60%60%60python%20exec%5Cnprint%28%5C%22Hello%20world!%5C%22%29%5Cn%60%60%60%5Cn%22%5D)

Let's run that code. It is kinda like a notebook.

We can get assistance in [writing code](command:stencila.walkthrough-file-type?%5B%22walkthru-1.smd%22%2C%22%20%5Cn%5Cn%3A%3A%3A%20do%20%40insert-code-chunk%20draw%20a%20sine%20wave%22%5D)

And now we can run that too.

That is just the beginning.

scripts.compile: npm run compile-dist && npm run compile-syntaxes && npm run compile-walkthroughs && npm run compile-ts
scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
